Package ca.cyberscientist.toystoredb.model

Class Toy

java.lang.Object
ca.cyberscientist.toystoredb.model.Toy
Direct Known Subclasses:
Animal, BoardGame, Figure, Puzzle
public abstract class Toy extends Object
Abstract class for Toy objects
Author:
Bryce Carson

  • Field Details

    • serialNumber

      private String serialNumber
      The serial number of the toy. This is a ten digit number.

    • name

      private String name
      The name of the toy. It could be anything.

    • brand

      private String brand
      The brand on the toy. The name of the manufacturer or maker of the toy. It could be anything.

    • price

      private double price
      The price of the toy. It could be any positive, non-zero monetary amount.

    • availableCount

      private int availableCount
      The number of a toy in stock and for sale.

    • appropriateAge

      private int appropriateAge
      The minimum age, in years, for which the manufacturer says the toy is intended for or for which it is appropriate.

  • Constructor Details

    • Toy

      public Toy(String serialNumber, String name, String brand, double price, int availableCount, int appropriateAge)
      Parameters:
      serialNumber - The serial number to associate with the toy.
      name - The name to associate with the toy.
      brand - The brand name (manufacturer) to associate with the toy.
      price - The cost of the toy in dollars and cents.
      availableCount - The number of this toy in inventory.
      appropriateAge - The minimum recommended age for this toy.

    • Toy

      public Toy()
      A constructor to use for generating a place-holder Animal.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      The toString method of all toys, providing a drier way to format each object for saving to disk. Ends with a semicolon so each toy type can merely append the next item.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String the pretty-printable form of the object.

    • format

      public abstract String format()
      Ensure that each subclass implements a format method to call the super.toString() method and append the subclass-specific information for saving to disk.
      Returns:
      The formatted string which will be used when saving the object to disk.
